SEARCH
Package edu.lehigh.cse216.adr325.admin

Class Database

java.lang.Object
edu.lehigh.cse216.adr325.admin.Database
public class Database extends Object
Database has all our logic for connecting to and interacting with a database.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static final record 
    Database.CommentRowData
    CommentRowData is a RowData object that represents a row in the Comment table
    static final record 
    Database.DownvoteRowData
    DownvoteRowData is a RowData object that represents a row in the Downvote table
    static final record 
    Database.PostRowData
    PostRowData is a RowData object that represents a row in the Post table
    static interface 
    Database.RowData
    RowData is like a struct in C: we use it to hold data, and we allow direct access to its immutable fields.
    static final record 
    Database.UpvoteRowData
    UpvoteRowData is a RowData object that represents a row in the Upvote table
    static final record 
    Database.UserRowData
    UserRowData is a RowData object that represents a row in the User table

  • Method Details

    • getRowDataValues

      boolean getRowDataValues(ArrayList<Object> values, Database.RowData row, String tableName)
      A helper function to get the values from a RowData object and add them to an ArrayList
      Parameters:
      values - The ArrayList to add the values to
      row - The RowData object to get the values from
      tableName - The name of the table to get the values for

    • createTable

      void createTable(String tableName)
      Create a table in the database. Only call with a sanitized table name!!!
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to create

    • dropTable

      void dropTable(String tableName)
      Remove table from the database. If it does not exist, this will print an error.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to drop

    • insertRow

      int insertRow(String tableName, Database.RowData row)
      Insert a row into the database
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to insert into
      row - The data to insert
      Returns:
      The number of rows that were inserted

    • updateOne

      int updateOne(String tableName, int id, Database.RowData row)
      Update the data for a row by ID
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to update
      id - The id of the row to update
      row - The new data for the row
      Returns:
      The number of rows that were updated. -1 indicates an error.

    • deleteRow

      int deleteRow(String tableName, int id)
      Delete a row by ID
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to delete from
      id - The id of the row to delete
      Returns:
      The number of rows that were deleted. -1 indicates an error.

    • selectAll

      ArrayList<Database.RowData> selectAll(String tableName)
      Query the database for a list of all subjects and their IDs
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to query
      Returns:
      All rows, as an ArrayList; null if an error occurred

    • selectOne

      Database.RowData selectOne(String tableName, int row_id)
      Get all data for a specific row, by ID
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to query
      row_id - The id of the row being requested
      Returns:
      The data for the requested row, or null if the ID was invalid

    • invalidateRow

      int invalidateRow(String tableName, int id)
      Invalidate a row by ID
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to invalidate from
      id - The id of the row to invalidate
      Returns:
      The number of rows that were invalidated. -1 indicates an error.

    • validateRow

      int validateRow(String tableName, int id)
      Validate a row by ID
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to validate from
      id - The id of the row to validate
      Returns:
      The number of rows that were validated. -1 indicates an error.

    • disconnect

      boolean disconnect()
      Close the current connection to the database, if one exists. NB: The connection will always be null after this call, even if an error occurred during the closing operation.
      Returns:
      true if the connection was cleanly closed, false otherwise

    • getDatabase

      static Database getDatabase(String dbUri)
      Uses dbUri to create a connection to a database, and stores it in the returned Database object
      Parameters:
      dbUri - the connection string for the database
      Returns:
      null upon connection failure, otherwise a valid Database with open connection

    • getDatabase

      static Database getDatabase(String ip, String port, String dbname, String user, String pass)
      Uses params to manually construct string for connecting to a database, and stores it in the returned Database object
      Parameters:
      ip - not strictly an ip, can also be a host name
      port - default tends to be 5432 or something like it
      dbname - generally should be non null
      user - generally required
      pass - generally required
      Returns:
      null upon connection failure, otherwise a valid Database with open connection

    • getDatabase

      static Database getDatabase()
      Uses the presence of environment variables to invoke the correct overloaded `getDatabase` method. Either DATABASE_URL should be set, or the values of four other variables POSTGRES_{IP, PORT, USER, PASS, DBNAME}.
      Returns:
      a valid Database object with active connection on success, null otherwise

    • populate

      void populate()
      Method to populate the database with some initial data
